Author: jl777c#5810
Content: after mine 17 blocks with second hash 0, you also need to keep mining until the hashrate is stable

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: i have seen that post-RST having some undesirable behavior, like triggerting another RST or exp(). ideally it stays quiet and the diff quickly gets to where the hashrate indicates it should be.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: once there are 17 blocks that are stable hashrate (diff and miningdiff would be very close), diff for past 17 blocks reasonably close, but randomness can create some variance

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so it is a judgement call whether the diff is stable and reflecting the hashrate

Author: SHossain#0007

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: reaching this state of stability is something that is needed at various times

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: basically from the moment to change the hashrate to when it reaches stability, that is really what this is all about

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: and we want that to be in as few blocks as possible, but we cant tell for sure until after the fact that it was indeed reached stability

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so it might take 20 extra blocks to realize it was actually stable 20 blocks ago

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: ideally we want to reach this hashrate/diff stability before changing the hashrate

Author: zawy#5864
Content: To get really fancy, make it a DAG.  Make max block size 1/6 as big and allow each block to reference 6 parent blocks and make solve time 10 seconds.  Your mempool needs to place a 1 or 2 minute hold on txns before miners randomly choose them so that they don't choose the same txns too often.   Since you now have 6 blocks per minute  you can adjust difficulty 6x faster, or have it SQRT(6) more stable. Double-spending solution for DAGs that I came up with is that 1st txn (the valid one) is the one with the most decendant work, not the one with the most ancestor work.  Someone should do a patent on that.  There is a no-incest aka no triagles rule in the connections. I think that means primarily  parents of the same block can have the each other as a parent.  to get even more fancy, each miner chooses his own target but the amount of coin he gets is determined by the DA.  The DA erward is per hash instead of per block.  So no need for pools.  Then you use VDF-POS to make it constant value and not need a bunch of mining equipment to be secure, but only use POW for generating and distribution coin with the above self-hashing txns.  Then put a bunch of these coins under the KMD umbrella so that merchannts only need to communicate with KMD, so all the sub coins are shards.  20 seconds txns, unlimited txns, no wasted minning for consensus, constant value, secured by BTC.

Author: zawy#5864
Content: But with VDF-POS you don't need such a fast DA.  But you do need the DAG to prove the VDF-POS network was intact.
